description: Marek Halden is appointed head of the Central Oversight Directorate, taking charge of national systems that track and coordinate citizen behavior and data.

The Directorate begins testing the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) in five regions. The system uses patterns in people's behavior and purchases to estimate how closely they follow government expectations.
The next phase of the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) begins. More data is collected quietly through deals with phone companies and businesses to widen the system's reach.
A closed government meeting ends without agreement on expanding predictive monitoring tools. Halden is temporarily given control over related funding decisions.
A glitch in the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) wrongly flags members of a visiting trade group, causing a diplomatic incident and prompting an internal review.
Halden changes how data flows through enforcement systems, giving his department sole control and cutting off other offices from seeing what's happening.
An audio clip, allegedly of Halden criticizing the military, spreads on encrypted message boards. Officials neither confirm nor deny its authenticity.
A quiet update to the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) is made from Halden's secure computer. It changes how easily people are flagged based on uncertain or borderline behaviors.
People who had been flagged by the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) start disappearing from watchlists. The problem is blamed on a temporary data error, but no clear reason is found.
Halden misses an important planning meeting. Staff last saw him working late the night before in his combined home and office in Tower 9.
Halden is found dead in his residence-office. There are no signs of violence. The initial cause is listed as heart failure.
Toxicology tests find traces of a drug used in psychiatric treatments. No investigation is opened, and the report is sealed.
The government announces Marek Halden's death in a brief statement, without giving a cause or naming a replacement.
Major technical problems appear across the system due to missing access codes tied to Halden's account. The Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) stops functioning normally.
